title: Does re-evaluation guarantee increase in marks?
content:
If the marks is closer to a greater grade, will re-evaluation guarantee increase in marks even if there's no mistake in correction?
Means there's no any other exact answer which guarantees marks increment but will grace be given?

comments.body: The average iq of the current first year is probably room temperature. And your contribution negative
70% of the time there is no increase after re-eval
Some of you need to think before asking a question. You guys clearly aren't using your brains enough.
